ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Timepoint/visit label
AASPIRE Participant Type / Version Administered
Notes: 1= Direct Report (DR); 2= Direct Report - Supported (DR-S); 3= Caregiver Report (CR)

ElementDescription: Have (Direct Report: you / Caregiver Report: they) ever had COVID-19?
Notes: 0= No; 1= Yes, (Direct Report: I / Caregiver Report: they) tested positive or (was/were) diagnosed by a medical professional; 2= Yes, I think (Direct Report: I / Caregiver Report: I think they they) had COVID-19, but (I/they) did not have a positive test or diagnosis; 3= I do not know

ElementDescription: Think about the worst case of COVID-19 (Direct Report: you have / Caregiver Report: they have) had. How severe (or bad) was it?
Notes: 1= (Direct Report: I was / Caregiver Report: They were) hospitalized (stayed in the hospital overnight for at least two nights, for your/their own health issues) at least once because of (my/their) COVID-19 symptoms; 2= (I was/They were) not hospitalized, but (I was/they were) very sick (e.g., so sick that I/they could hardly get out of bed); 3= (I was/I think they were) moderately sick (e.g., felt really bad but I/they could still get out of bed and do some of the activities I/they normally do at home); 4= (I had/I think they had) mild COVID-19 symptoms (e.g., felt like I/they had a cold or were a little tired, but still could do most of the activities I/they normally do at home; 5= (I/They) had no COVID-19 symptoms

ElementDescription: Do you think (Direct Report: you / Caregiver Report: they) had a case of COVID-19 that started within the last 6 months?
Notes: 0= No; 1= Yes; 2= I am not sure

ElementDescription: Do you think (Direct Report: you / Caregiver Report: they) have had Long-COVID Syndrome (also sometimes called ''COVID-19 long haulers syndrome'' or ''long-term sequelae of COVID-19'')?
Notes: 1= I think (Direct Report: I / Caregiver Report: they) have Long-COVID now; 2= I think (I/they) had Long-COVID in the past, but (I/they) mostly or completely got over it; 3= I do not think (I/they) ever had Long-COVID; 4= I do not know

ElementDescription: About how long have (Direct Report: you / Caregiver Report: they) had symptoms of Long-COVID Syndrome?
Notes: 1= Less than a month; 2= 1-3 months; 3= 4-6 months; 4= 7-12 months; 5= More than a year

ElementDescription: How severe (bad) are (Direct Report: your / Caregiver Report: their) Long COVID symptoms now?
Notes: [Direct Report] 1= Mild e.g., (Direct Report: I / Caregiver Report: they) notice them, but symptoms do not really get in the way of (my/their) usual activities.; 2= Moderate e.g., (I/they) cannot exercise or socialize as much as (I/they) used to.; 3= Severe e.g., (I/they) have had to make major changes to (my/their) daily life.; 4= Extreme e.g., (I/they) can barely get out of bed

ElementDescription: In general, would you say (Direct Report: your / Caregiver Report: their) health is:
Notes: 1= Poor; 2= Fair; 3= Good; 4= Very good; 5= Excellent

Notes: 0= Not at all confident; 10= Totally confident
